reviews.sentence: Very Relaxing. We booked this hotel never having been in Palm Springs before. The location was okay however not really in walking distance to anything. There were a fair amount of amenities within driving distance and close to a Panera Breads our favourite breakfast lunch location. The hotel is a bit outdated. When I booked it I was certain it stated the rooms had been renovated but they are looking worn and do not look as good in person as they do in pictures. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious. This hotel is full of families which we did not mind as we have older kids at home. Pool was really great and the service at the pool also good. We got a fantastic rate through west jet vacations so I really can not complain about price for value. Would I stay here again. I would likely find another hotel to try as this one was nothing to write home about.
Excellent. Bed like a cloud for sure. Room was excellent. Wish the lobby was more updated and attractive.

Great food average hotel food for a conference. Here for a conference. Decent sized rooms good on site food. Rooms need a facelift especially bathrooms. Typical mid range Mariot. Spa service was excellent.

Disappointed Stay away when cheerleaders are there. I totally agree with another reviewer regarding the screaming cheerleaders running rampant through this hotel. This was our first time at this Mariot but we have previously stayed at the Palm Desert Mariot during the summer and have had this same problem. If you are going to have groups like this keep them in a separate section of the hotel away from the other guests. I do not appreciate paying 160 for a room and then having to listen to screaming girls slamming doors and running through the corridors at all hours. I also got slammed into when walking down the hallway by two girls who were racing. You would be better off staying at one of the casino hotels where they do not have teeny boper cheerleader camps. Some other issues were with cleanliness and maintenance. We also noticed that after the screaming memies had meals in their rooms they would leave their dirty dishes out in the hallway some still half full of food. These plates from dinner were still stacked in the hallways the next day. Really. How disgusting. How can that not be noticed by hotel personnel when you deliver newspapers to the rooms each morning. You can not tell me that does not attract rats and bugs. We also had a problem with our shower. It was a shower tub combo. The shower head worked great but the drain would quickly back up and you would end up standing in ankle deep water by the end of your shower. I called the front desk and they said they would have maintenance come right away but they never did. I left another message but still no response. I do not know about you but I would not put up with that at my house I would have it fixed and not ignore it. I really wanted to like this hotel. The property is lovely and the pool area is very nice. There was also an aerospace meeting going on when we were there so the bar area tended to get a little busy at night but the staff there was very good and handled the crowd well order the date pistachio cookies. We also had lunch at Cava restaurant which was quiet and the service was good. Our only saving grace was that we booked a larger corner room so we were not exactly in the middle of the cheerleader fray but still close enough to be annoyed and disappointed.

Almost perfect. We took my parents to this resort for a little vacation. The overall hotel and grounds are beautiful. The lobby atrium and lounge put you in the perfect mood for a relaxing get away. We had adjoining rooms as requested. They were very large and nicely appointed. What a nice surprise to have a bathroom with double sinks and a private room for the commode. Although the pool was huge and even has a sandy beach it needs refurbishing. There are many areas of peeling and flakey paint in the pool. There are plenty of lounge chairs tables and umbrellas. We ate dinner at the Cava restaurant because it had the most varied menu. The place could use an update. The seats were dirty from previous customers. The seafood buffet was great. The braised beef was disappointing. No matter where we were the staff was exceptional attentive and very friendly. Overall we had a very nice and relaxing weekend. We would definitely stay here again.

Needs some renovation work. Has potential but run down in some areas. Needs new paint beverage machines not working lounge chairs dirty general maintenance. Beds are super comfy and pool layout is great.

Classic old school resort hotel could do with a bit of a refurb large resort hotel the check procedure and porterage works well self park is a bit of a hike so use the valet if you do not fancy a walk or will be suing the car a few times during the day. Good breakfast pool bar is top notch but the sun loungers are packed so tightly its almost funny the pool was not busy when we visited but it must be bedlam in good weather with a full house. Rooms are pretty good seem dated and in need of a refurb particularly considering the room price.

Great family hotel. Hotel was great we spent most of our day around the pool with the kids. We only noticed a sewer type of smell in the morning while we were having breakfast at Cava they were doing some reno not sure if related.

Hotel staff were friendly. Pool was great. Remodeling the rooms so only so many were being used. did not hear the construction hotel was not packed at all. Ate at the pizza restaurant pretty good. Look forward to the updated hotel.
After the full renovation that is progress it will be a five star review.
Overall guest services were Excellent. Beautiful renovated room with view to golf course.
The resort property is beautiful. Our room was newly renovated and was very clean. There is plenty of view points. The pool was fun. My 3 kids had a blast.
I liked the friendly service from the moment we arrived on property. Rooms were newly remodeled with a modern twist. Service was great. It was a great time.

After its redesign this place is amazing. 3 pools one that has a beach entrance and 2 hot tubs. Beautiful golf course next door. The rooms have all been upgraded. One thing that was annoying is the elevator is on one side so everytime I left or had to get something from my car I had to walk all the way to the other side to go down. Our room ws above the registration area but no elevator near it.
The rooms have been renovated excellent view of the golf course mountains. The hotel is fabulous. My stay was great.

The property has just been remodeled and the rooms are large and very well done. Bathroom has double sinks. Door in toilet area was put on wrong and my husband got stuck in there so that needs fixing. We will definitely return.

This is a 10 Star Resort. Five stars does n’t do it justice. The property is amazingly beautiful. The huge open majestic lobby is absolutely stunning with views of the pool lagoon and mountains. But a beautiful hotel does not necessarily make for a great stay but this hotel exudes friendliness the employees go out of their way to help you out the staff from the maintenance crews to housekeeping to wait staff to management. all a 10 plus. Every where we went they were so helpful and accommodating. One of the best properties we have ever been to. Could spend our entire stay just in our lovely room.

Wonderful first stay 45 stars. I did quit a bit of research looking for a family friendly resort in or near Palm Springs. The top contenders included this one Omni big water park JW gondola rides and Hyat animal habitat and arcade. We ended up choosing Renaissance because of the variety of things to do with a toddler and because of the new renovation we love the muted pinks and blue greens with the pop of teal and black. There ’s a no entry sandy beach pool in case you want to watch your child swim but think it ’s too cold me unles it ’s over 86 degrees. Sand for building castles. A kids club open fri to sun with crafts such as bracelet making art movies. A theater playing movies on weekends. And I read about it in the reviews a pizza making class at the SPC Restaurant. I figured I did n’t want to be stuck all day at the water slide or arcade. There was a hiccup in the class schedule but the resort more than exceeded my expectations making it happen We even got to choose a movie of our choice complete with popcorn in the theater.

This is a great hotel in the perfect location. Rooms were just all renovated and they look awesome. A quick Uber ride to lots of restaurants and amenities. Hotel has an awesome pool with tons of chairs and yummy drinks food. Lobby bar has a great ambiance and great outdoor fireplaces to relax for an evening drink snack. I do n’t golf but the course looks great.
